result.execSummary:
The defendant Monteal D Foster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Monteal D Foster is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Monteal D Foster was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
01:23 PM Defendant Monteal D Foster in court, in custody.  David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Dean Fleisner is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is a sergeant with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 1/2/22, he was dispatched to a residence in the City of Wisconsin regarding a vehicle blocking a driveway. When he arrived, he observed a person passed out in a vehicle. The defendant identified himself. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. He was advised that defendant had a warrant for Wood County. He found a piece of tin foil in defendant's pocket. Defendant admitted that it was methamphetamine. The substance was tested and it did test positive for methamphetamine. The jail staff advised him that a pipe was found on the defendant. He was advised defendant was out on bond for other cases.
Attorney Knaapen asks Court to take judicial notice of Wood Coutny 21CF367 & 21CF427, cases defendant was out on bond for. Court takes jujdicial notice.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Information will be filed at a later time.  Arraignment scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on January 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

02:01 PM Defendant Monteal D Foster in court, in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Monteal D Foster appeared by video means.
Transferred to Branch 3 for preliminary hearing. Bond is continued.

01:54 PM Defendant Monteal D Foster not in court, defendant in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is refusing to appear. Attorney Lambert is requesting that bond be set. He asks for high cash bond.
Court will set bond today, but defendant will need to be forcibly brought in to make his appearance tomorrow.
